qas.question: What were de Melo's greatest reforms?
Why did e Melo demarcate the region for production of Port?
Did de Melo impose strict laws only on one class of people?

answers.text: upon all classes of Portuguese society from the high nobility to the poorest working class

qas.question: Among which class did de Melo's reforms gain him the most enemies?
Who was the first person to try to ensure the wine's quality in Portugal?

context: But <a4_0>Sebastião de Melo<a4_0/>'s greatest reforms were <a0_0>economic and financial<a0_0/>, with the creation of several companies and guilds to regulate every commercial activity. He demarcated the region for production of Port <a1_0>to ensure the wine's quality<a1_0/>, and this was the first attempt to control wine quality and production in Europe. He ruled with a strong hand by imposing strict law <a2_0>upon all classes of Portuguese society from the high nobility to the poorest working class<a2_0/>, along with a widespread review of the country's tax system. These reforms gained him enemies in the upper classes, <a3_0>especially among the high nobility<a3_0/>, who despised him as a social upstart.
